title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - REVISED
description: The revised RFC aims to gather and document the comprehensive requirements for the LLMTuner tool. This includes specific use cases (e.g., text generation, sentiment analysis, question answering), target domains (scientific research, customer service, creative writing), desired features (real-time training, model versioning, collaborative workspace, data visualization, exportable reports), integration points with existing systems (APIs for data import/export, support for popular frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, compatibility with common cloud services), data sources (public datasets, custom data sources, ability to integrate user-provided data), security and privacy considerations (data encryption at rest and in transit, anonymization techniques, compliance with GDPR, user authentication and authorization, addressing potential risks of model bias), scalability and performance requirements (support for large models, efficient training pipelines, optimization for various hardware configurations, consideration for edge devices), accessibility features (screen reader support, keyboard navigation, color contrast ratios to meet WCAG guidelines), and any other relevant constraints or assumptions. The task will also provide a clear roadmap detailing the development phases, timelines, and milestones for each phase, including key deliverables, target dates, and contingency plans. Additionally, it will include a section for potential risks and mitigation strategies, as well as a plan for user feedback and iterative improvements. Comparisons with similar tools or projects are encouraged to aid understanding. The updated RFC is now ready for the next state (i.e., 'task-decomposer' for further decomposition of tasks). To ensure alignment with our team's development practices, I suggest adding more emphasis on testability and maintainability of the codebase, as well as modularity to facilitate future updates and expansions.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture for LLMTuner, including the components, data flow, and interactions between modules.

title: Develop Data Preparation Pipeline
description: Implement the data preparation pipeline for cleaning, formatting, and preprocessing data for fine-tuning the large language models.

title: Implement Model Training and Optimization
description: Develop the core functionality for fine-tuning and optimizing large language models, including model loading, training loop, and hyperparameter tuning.

title: Build Performance Evaluation Module
description: Create a module for evaluating the performance of fine-tuned models, including metrics calculation, model comparison, and result visualization.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement a user-friendly interface for interacting with LLMTuner, including data management, training configuration, and result analysis.

title: Implement Security and Access Control
description: Develop security measures and access control mechanisms to ensure data privacy and secure model fine-tuning and deployment.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Establish a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deployment of LLMTuner to various environments.

title: Write Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation and user guides for LLMTuner, covering installation, usage, and advanced features.

title: Conduct Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute thorough testing strategies, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, to ensure the quality and reliability of LLMTuner.
